questions.question: A stranger on the street asks you for money for a bus ticket. They seem distressed. What do you do?

choices.optionA: Give them the money without asking too many questions.
choices.optionB: Politely refuse, as you are skeptical of their story.

questions.question: You see a social media post with a shocking headline from a source you've never heard of. What's your first reaction?

choices.optionA: Share it immediately; people need to know!
choices.optionB: Look for other sources to verify the information before sharing.

questions.question: You're at a party where you don't know many people. What are you most likely to do?

choices.optionA: Find a quiet corner and observe the room.
choices.optionB: Introduce yourself to new people and strike up conversations.

questions.question: When you have a strong opinion on a topic, you usually...

choices.optionA: ...keep it to yourself unless asked directly.
choices.optionB: ...enjoy expressing your viewpoint in a discussion.

questions.question: You're given a choice between a familiar favorite meal and a new, exotic dish you've never tried. You choose...

choices.optionA: The familiar favorite. You know you'll enjoy it.
choices.optionB: The new dish. You're curious to experience something different.

questions.question: When planning a vacation, you prefer to...

choices.optionA: ...have a detailed itinerary with every day planned out.
choices.optionB: ...have a general idea of where you're going but leave room for spontaneity.

quizzes.title: Are You an Introvert or Extrovert?

questions.question: You're working on a group project. Your role is usually...

choices.optionA: ...the leader, organizing the tasks and keeping everyone on track.
choices.optionB: ...a contributor, focusing on your assigned tasks and supporting the leader.

questions.question: When faced with a difficult problem, you tend to...

choices.optionA: ...break it down into smaller, manageable steps.
choices.optionB: ...look at the big picture and brainstorm creative solutions.

questions.question: You've made a mistake at work. You...

choices.optionA: ...try to fix it quietly before anyone notices.
choices.optionB: ...own up to it immediately and ask for help if needed.

questions.question: At a social gathering, you usually...

choices.optionA: ...arrive early and help the host prepare.
choices.optionB: ...fashionably late when the party is in full swing.

questions.question: When someone shares good news, you...

choices.optionA: ...make you think deeply about complex themes.
choices.optionB: ...are action-packed and keep you on the edge of your seat.
...see how you feel and decide spontaneously.
